IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: margin-left:10px; padding:0in 0in 31.0pt 0in">MSP unmarked vehicle L-40 is equipped with a mobile recording device / BWC operational SCENE PROCESSING: Stored property for safekeeping Canvasedthe immediate area PHYSICAL EVIDENCE: One (1) SIG Sauer P365 serial number: 66B151789, One (1) black ammunition magazine and Ten (10) 9mm ammunition rounds was recovered and stored for safekeeping according to MSP policy and regulations. The property was verified by Sgt. Bolduc #4889. The property referenced above was listed on the MSP Form 67 chain of custody under the Property Held P-339130. NARRATIVE: On 2/10/2023, at approximately 1000 hours, I, TFC Arioso 7268, was dispatched by the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack to the area of S/B I-495 from the area of Branch Avenue to the Woodrow Wilson Bridge for a lost hand gun. I had been advised the owner of the lost hand gun, Charles Quentin Pearson II, (B/M 06/06/1971), was traveling to work on S/B I-495 in the area of Branch Avenue on his motorcycle when Pearson quickly realized his hand gun (SIG Sauer P635 serial number: 66B151789) that was inside a backpack that was on Pearsons person, had come out of the backpack and unknown to be found on I-495. I then canvased the area with unsuccessful findings of the firearm. Soon after, at approximately 1145 hours, a concerned citizen who was changing his tire in the area of S/B I-495 at Indian Head Highway in the through lanes, called the Forestville Barrack and advised he had found a black handgun on the left shoulder. Upon my arrival, I made contact with the caller who was identified as Cameron Darrell Henderson (H/M 7/25/1986) by his Maryland drivers license, advised he was changing his flat tire when he observed a black handgun and magazine and immediately contacted the Forestville Barrack. I then returned to my patrol vehicle to obtain a written witness statement form and proper gloves to retrieve the firearm. The firearm was observed to be the same make and model with the same serial number confirmed by the Forestville Duty Officer (Sgt. Bolduc) as the same lost firearm earlier this morning. The firearm and magazine were recovered and placed in a property bag and placed inside my patrol vehicle. All property was recovered and transported to the Forestville Barrack. Once arrived at the Forestville Barrack, Sgt. Bolduc contacted the Maryland State Police Gun Center and provided all required firearm and owner information. Results were shortly returned, showing Charles Quentin Pearson II to be the owner of the recovered firearm. The handgun, magazine, and ammunition rounds were stored for safekeeping according to MSP policy and regulations. The property referenced above was listed on the MSP Form 67 chain of custody under the Property Held P-339130. The owner was then contacted via telephone and was advised his recovered firearm was located at the Forestville Barrack, and he was to make contact with the Duty Officer to retrieve his property and sign all required paperwork. All above events occurred in Prince Georges County, MD.
